3.  Distributor's undertakings
The Distributor undertakes and agrees with the Supplier that at all times during the Term it will:
(a)	use all reasonable endeavours to promote the distribution and sale of the Products;
(b)	not use any promotional or advertising material for the Products not approved by the Supplier,
such approval not be unreasonably withheld;
(c)	provide Yearly non-binding sales forecasts;
(d)	establish and maintain documented procedures for identifying the Products with a control number
for traceability and copies of those records and procedures must be made available to the Supplier
within thirty (30) days of request;
perturbation.changed_text:
3.  Distributor's undertakings
The Distributor undertakes and agrees with the Supplier that at all times during the Term it will:
(a)	use all reasonable endeavours to promote the distribution and sale of the Products;
(b)	not use any promotional or advertising material for the Products not approved by the Supplier,

perturbation.explanation: The original contract requires the distributor to provide documented procedures for product identification within 30 days of request. By changing this to 5 days, it creates a potential conflict with reasonableness standards and business practices, as well as creates an unreasonable time period to fulfill the request, which may violate general contract law principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Reasonableness, Business Practices
